programme.title: Motorstories
programme.sub-title: Mercedes 280 SE goes America - New York
programme.desc: Tillmann starts his dream journey in New York, the city that never sleeps. With his Mercedes 280 SE convertible he visits the legendary classic car dealer Eliot Cuker who made his fortune with his passion for old cars.

programme.title: Arden AJ23
programme.desc: A Jaguar that is able to terrify the world alone with its roar. This Jaguar F-Type R tuned by Arden is a real bad boy. Already in the series production configuration, the F-Type R Coupe is a dream car that can really bite but this Jaguar which has been upgraded from Arden, now calls itself "AJ23“ and is more powerful, louder and more aggressive than any of his brothers.

programme.title: Jaguar XJR
programme.desc: The highlight of the XJR lies beneath the hood: all of Jaguar's top models are equipped with the 5-liter V8 compressor engine that delivers 550 HP in this sports sedan.

programme.title: 4x4
programme.desc: The Mitsubishi Outlander Plug-In Hybrid, the world's first hybrid SUV with two electric motors and a 2-liter combustion engine. Also: the Chevrolet Silverado, an American full-size pickup with a V8 and an average consumption of at least 15 liters.

programme.title: 4x4
programme.desc: The Bentley EXP 9F and Jaguar C-X17 are concept cars the two manufacturers presented before they started making their own luxury SUVs. Also: how did Toyota, Nissan or Subaru see the future of the SUV? And: Mercedes-Benz' Unimog concept car.

programme.title: 4x4
programme.desc: The SUVs Nissan X-Trail and BMW X4 aren't typical offroaders. We witnessed the presentation of the new X-Trail model and BMW's premiere of their X4. Also: the Steinbeißer Trophy, where unusual offroad vehicles take part in a demanding rally.

programme.title: BMW M3
programme.desc: In the late 80s BMW brought a car onto the market which carried true racing genes. Initially conceived as a homologation model for the German Touring Car Championship, it developed into being one of the world's hottest street sports car. Whenever its name is mentioned, car fans feel goosebumps - even today: the BMW M3.

programme.title: Bentley Bentayga
programme.desc: With the Bentley Bentayga, the traditional British brand is entering the fastest growing market segment. This world's first luxury SUV is a conglomerate of superlatives on wheels.

programme.title: Volvo XC60
programme.desc: The Swedish landscape is characterized by mountains, forests and lonely roads. Ideal for this off-roader. The Volvo XC60 scores with many safety features and a cool appearance.

programme.title: Stunt Heroes
programme.desc: This episode features Action Concept's stunt highlights from all previous specials, from exciting car stunts to meticulously choreographed fight scenes and even some snowmobile shootout action.

programme.title: Stunt Heroes
programme.desc: This time, an industrial site is the scene for the stunt extravaganza. The Stunt Heroes' objective: jump through a truck trailer with a car. As usual with such risky car stunts, careful planning, preparation, timing and precision are of the essence.

programme.title: Stunt Heroes
programme.desc: In a race between a dump truck and a car, man and machine are brought to their limits. Stuntman Stefan receives a load of gravel for his birthday, instead of confetti.

programme.title: Audi MTM S8 Talladega R
programme.desc: The Audi S8 Plus is by no means underpowered, but it is and remains faithful to this model series' understatement. Those who want more power can get a boost from MTM.

programme.title: Ferrari California T
programme.desc: The Ferrari California T has a lot of Italian passion and elegant lines to offer. Super sports car cabriolets are popular all over the world. It is no wonder that more and more manufacturers are 'opening up'.

programme.title: BMW Active Hybrid 7
programme.desc: With the Active Hybrid 7, unlike with its predecessor bearing the same model name, BMW now banks on a full hybrid, which can also be driven solely with electric power.

programme.title: Biker Lifestyle
programme.desc: Lake Faaker is both a popular holiday spot in Austria and also a place with a special tradition. In early September, the region is the destination for thousands of bikers who celebrate their big annual event, the European Bike Week. (Part 1 of 5)

programme.title: Biker Lifestyle
programme.desc: Lake Faaker is both a popular holiday spot in Austria and also a place with a special tradition. In early September, the region is the destination for thousands of bikers who celebrate their big annual event, the European Bike Week. (Part 2 of 5)

programme.title: Biker Lifestyle
programme.desc: Lake Faaker is both a popular holiday spot in Austria and also a place with a special tradition. In early September, the region is the destination for thousands of bikers who celebrate their big annual event, the European Bike Week. (Part 3 of 5)

programme.title: Biker Lifestyle
programme.desc: Lake Faaker is both a popular holiday spot in Austria and also a place with a special tradition. In early September, the region is the destination for thousands of bikers who celebrate their big annual event, the European Bike Week. (Part 4 of 5)

programme.title: Biker Lifestyle
programme.desc: Lake Faaker is both a popular holiday spot in Austria and also a place with a special tradition. In early September, the region is the destination for thousands of bikers who celebrate their big annual event, the European Bike Week. (Part 5 of 5)

programme.title: Harley-Davidson Trio
programme.desc: We took a look at three very different Harley-Davidson models. The versatile Switchback Dyna, the motorized wheelie bike Sportster 72, and the bad-boy motorcycle Softail Slim.

programme.title: KTM 990 Adventure
programme.desc: It's very big and mostly comes in orange: the KTM 990 Adventure. Over rough terrain it's often driven standing up. Today, the 990 is considered the off-road specialist among travel Enduros.

programme.title: Facel Vega Facellia
programme.desc: In the late 1950s, the Facel Vega Facellia was designed to compete with Porsche and Alfa Romeo and open a new market segment for the fledgling French luxury car company.

programme.title: Tuning
programme.desc: At the Essen Motor Show over 500 exhibitors present the latest highlights from the car tuning scene. Everything can be found here, from accessories available to everyone to handmade sports cars and top class tuning.

programme.title: Tuning
programme.desc: Abt Sportsline stands for car tuning at the highest level. Abt's slogan isn't 'from the race track to the road ' for nothing. Also: the Rohte VW Golf R20. And: the BMW Art Car.

programme.title: Tuning
programme.desc: We visited Brabus, the largest independent automobile tuner where you can find more than 9,000 HP in one place. Also: MTM's Audi RS6 Clubsport.

programme.title: Tuning
programme.desc: The Berlin-based company TH Automobiles equips Volkswagen vans with Porsche engines, turning a T5 into one of the most dynamic large saloon cars in the world.

programme.title: Tuning
programme.desc: The Conti Tuning Day is themed "Power Sedans" and we take a closer look at the cars on display. Plus: Swiss eccentric Ueli Anliker has built the most expensive Mercedes-AMG SLR in the world, the "Red Gold Dream".

programme.title: Tuning
programme.desc: Gemballa specialises in refining Porsche models, but its portfolio also includes brands such as Ferrari. And: the car tuning company Irmscher turns the Chevrolet Camaro into the 'Irmscher Camaro i42'.

programme.title: Porsche 550 RS Spyder
programme.desc: Small, lightweight, agile and swift as an arrow. Historic image documents of the Porsche 550 RS Spyder.

programme.title: BMW 750i xDrive
programme.desc: The BMW 750i is the second most powerful car in the 7 series. It may be mercilessly overpowered for the daily commute to work, but thanks to this power the two-ton vehicle doesn't feel as heavy as it actually is.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: What better way is there to celebrate a stylish and powerful car and a sunny summer day than going for a cruise over the Alps to Italy in a Maserati GranCabrio MC? In addition: a Brit with a fiery temperament, the Jaguar XK-RS convertible with 550 hp. And: Mercedes AMG's SL models, uncompromising performance.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.sub-title: On Patrol with the Dubai Police
programme.desc: In a city that loves to show off wealth and luxury, the Dubai police are eager to represent this image via its fleet of patrol cars that includes a Chevrolet Camaro, a Lamborghini Aventador, a Bentley GT, a Ferrari FF, an Aston Martin and a Mercedes SLS. For the first time ever, the Dubai Police Special Cars Unit allowed a television crew to accompany them on their service missions.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: Aerodynamics crucially influence the performance, track stability and dynamics of a vehicle. We took the Porsche 911 Turbo S, the BMW M6 convertible and the Kelleners 330d to the test and explored the influence of different wings and spoilers.

programme.title: Audi R8 V10 plus
programme.desc: The second generation of the Audi R8. V10 naturally aspirated engine, up to 610 horsepower and 330 kilometers an hour. A supercar with a lot of character.

programme.title: Audi RS7 Sportback Performance
programme.desc: The Audi RS7 Sportback performance is the spearhead of the Audi 7 series with the acceleration values of a super sports car. But it cannot play to its strengths in hectic urban traffic.

programme.title: Volvo Laplander 6x6
programme.desc: More extremes are always possible. Volvo's Laplander army vehicle has 6 wheels, 3 axles and provides space for at least 12 soldiers.

programme.title: Trackmasters
programme.desc: The Nürburgring is the place where you can really let your hair down on a spectacular and difficult race track and learn how to get fit for motor sports. This is the reason why motoring enthusiasts go there throughout the year.

programme.title: Trackmasters
programme.desc: We prepared some very entertaining clips from the Nürburgring for you. Expect to see the pedal on the metal and rubber burning.

programme.title: Trackmasters
programme.desc: When the weather cleared up a bit at the Nürburgring, we were finally back at the track. As soon as the snow and ice were gone the horsepower junkies returned to the ring to once again let their engines roar.

programme.title: Artega GT
programme.desc: From 2006 to 2012 the German company Artega produced their GT sports car model. Thanks to the know-how of a former Porsche and BMW manager the Artega GT was able to be manufactured in a small series.

programme.title: Ferrari California T
programme.desc: The Ferrari California T has a lot of Italian passion and elegant lines to offer. Super sports car cabriolets are popular all over the world. It is no wonder that more and more manufacturers are 'opening up'.

programme.title: Chevrolet Caprice 9C1 police car
programme.desc: This 1994 Chevrolet Caprice 9C1 is a former police car from the Los Angeles Police Department. Its curvaceous body was often mocked as looking like a whale, but this Chevy Caprice possesses the qualities of a shark.

programme.title: Mustang
programme.desc: The Ford Mustang Shelby GT-500 was born of the 1960's vibe and the racing experience of Carroll Shelby. Its "boulevard cruiser" style and powerful engine made this muscle car one of the highest sellers of its time.

programme.title: Corvette
programme.desc: The 1963 Split-Window Stingray Coupe combined power, performance, precision and youthful design. Its unique, sleek and progressive look has kept it a perennial favorite with auto enthusiasts and collectors.

programme.title: Oldsmobile
programme.desc: The Oldsmobile F88 was a GM "dream car" with sleek, sophisticated styling, but it never reached production. After many decades, there is one to be seen, and how and why it is finally available to view is a story in itself!

programme.title: Pierce Arrow
programme.desc: 1913 38C Brougham - "built up to a standard, not down to a price" - was worth the value of several houses at the time, with the special cachet of being the first car owned by the White House.

programme.title: Duesenberg
programme.desc: The 1930 Model J Duesenberg was the pinnacle of automotive engineering in power and speed, holding records not surpassed until the 1960's. Magnates like Hearst, the King of Spain and the movie star Gary Cooper owned Duesenbergs.

programme.title: Terraplane
programme.desc: The Hudson Terraplane 1937 Series 72 was a fast and affordable car with unique style and innovative design. But the cars were also reliable and well built, so the company, unlike others, survived the Depression.

programme.title: Chevrolet Corvair
programme.desc: Despite a production number of nearly 1.4 million units the Chevrolet Corvair is virtually unknown in Europe. It was innovative, efficient, modern and cheap. Nevertheless, it was slandered, torn apart and later reviled.

programme.title: Jaguar E-Type
programme.desc: On 15 March 1961 an E-Type Coupe was presented to the press at the Geneva Motor Show. The response to the shrill Jaguar was mostly positive. In Geneva alone, 500 E-Types were ordered. However It was initially not clear whether the E-Type could be presented in Geneva at all, because the car was finished so late that test driver Norman Dewis had to race the exhibit from Coventry to Geneva in the shortest time.

programme.title: Bentley S2 Continental Flying Spur
programme.desc: Flowing lines and an elegance that is unmatched. The 1959 Bentley S2 Continental Flying Spur aims to build bridges in the company's model range. From the sporty origin of the brand to the luxury of its new owner, Rolls Royce.

programme.title: Citroen DS
programme.desc: La Déesse. The goddess of Citroën. This car caused an uproar when it was presented in 1955 at the Paris Motor Show. The DS was the first sedan with disc brakes and hydropneumatic suspension, and its design was simply divine.

programme.title: Perfect Ride
programme.desc: What are the characteristics of a typical German car? Do stereotypes like functionality, reliability but also a certain dullness paint a realistic picture? Also, we explored if the Volkswagen Golf GTE could bring new impulses to the brand's model range.

programme.title: Perfect Ride
programme.desc: Slippery or muddy roads and bad visibility are circumstances that often spoil driving pleasure in winter. We took two almost identical Porsche 911's to an icy test track. Also: drifting fun in the snow with the Suzuki SX4 S-Cross.

programme.title: Perfect Ride
programme.desc: 4-door coupes combine the best of two worlds, the performance of a coupe and the style of a limousine. We took a closer look at three examples of this car subspecies, the Audi A7, BMW's 4 Series Gran Coupe, and the Mercedes-Benz CLA models.

programme.title: Perfect Ride
programme.desc: The top-of-the-line specimens of a car model range are built for pure driving pleasure. We put the VW Golf R, the Audi TTS and the BMW M 235i to the test in order to see if they are worthy of bearing the crown of their model range.

programme.title: Perfect Ride
programme.desc: In 2015 Audi presented a facelift for their city racer A1. We put this compact to the test. Also: it's a tough competition in the compact class, and Renault and Peugeot also want a piece of the pie. We compared the Renault Twingo and the Peugeot 108.

programme.title: Mercedes 300 SL Lightweight
programme.desc: An iconic racing car and one of only 29 ever built! We accompanied the Mercedes 300 SL 'lightweight' on its premiere drive at the Mille Miglia.

programme.title: Put your car on TV
programme.desc: The search for the fastest, best looking and best sounding car continues. Once more car lovers from the Middle East bring their tuned vehicles to the Sofitel Dubai Jumeirah Beach and have it judged by Saif Hattawi. The winner receives a special treat for two people from the luxurious Sofitel Dubai Jumeirah Beach. A Ford Mustang and a limited edition Chevrolet Corvette try to win the competition.

programme.title: Put your car on TV
programme.desc: Put Your Car on TV gives every car owner the chance to bring their tuned machines to the Sofitel Hotel Dubai Jumeirah beach. There, Saif Hattawi will assess each car based on speed, style and sound. The person with the most amazing car wins a one night stay at the Sofitel Hotel Dubai Jumeirah Beach for two people. A BMW X6M, a massive Ford F250 and a special Nissan Patrol try to win this prize.

programme.title: Put your car on TV
programme.desc: The Walk' at JBR, the most prestigious location in Dubai, sets the background for the fastest customized cars in the Middle East. Put Your Car on TV invites car owners to present their cars and have it judged. The owner of the fastest, most beautiful and best sounding car wins a special treat from Sofitel Dubai Jumeirah Beach. Among the competitors are a Lamborghini Aventador and a GMC Chevrolet.

programme.title: Put your car on TV
programme.desc: Once more, Mylene Gomera and Saif Hattawi are on the hunst for the most amazing cars in the world and ask car owners to bring their customized vehicles to Dubai, where it will be awarded points based on speed, style and sound. The car with the points wins a stay at the Sofitel Hotel Dubai Jumeirah Beach for two people. Among the presented cars are a limited edition Mercedes SLS and an Audi R8.

programme.title: Put your car on TV
programme.desc: On Put Your Car on TV people from the Middle East present their tuned vehicles. They are rewarded with points based on its styling, the highest (possible) speed ever driven und naturally also its sound. Whoever receives the most points, wins a luxurious treat from the Sofitel Hotel Dubai Jumeirah Beach. This time, a Lexus GSF, a Ford Mustang and a McLaren MP4-12C are put on the spotlight.

programme.title: Mercedes-AMG GT S Performmaster
programme.desc: Not far from Stuttgart is the home of the tuner Performmaster who specialize in the performance optimization of Mercedes-AMG models. They turned the already more-than-potent GT S sports car into a beast.

programme.title: Beradino
programme.desc: A „bella macchina“, a beautiful car - but not designed by masters like Bertone or Pininfarina. Johannes Paulussen from Neuss in Germany built the Beradino by hand.

programme.title: Classic Ride
programme.desc: We present to you historic image and film documents from the Porsche 550 RS Spyder. And: how the Audi Quattro shocked its competitors with its driving dynamics.

programme.title: Classic Ride
programme.desc: High-tech turbo cars from the wild 1980s are reunited at the Salzburgring race track. Also: the Lancia Beta Monte Carlo, a small Italian two-seater with mid-engine offers classic car driving pleasure at a low entry price.

programme.title: Classic Ride
programme.desc: The 1947 Triumph 1800 Roadster provides space for 5 fresh air fans. Also: Le Jog, the toughest classic car rally in Europe. A German women's team takes on the challenge in their VW Iltis. And: a charming oldie, the 1919 Wolseley Stellite.
